org.openimaj.audio.filters

Class TriangularFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.audio.filters.TriangularFilter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MelFilter

    public class TriangularFilter
extends Object
    A default non-isoceles triangular filter definition, where the low, mid and top frequencies are defined.
    Version:
    $Author$, $Revision$, $Date$
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
    Created:
    13 Dec 2012

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double centreFrequency
      The centre (peak) frequency of the filter
      protected double filterAmplitude
      The height of the filter
      protected double highFrequency
      The highest frequency of the filter
      protected double highSlope
      The slope of the second half of the filter
      protected double lowFrequency
      The lowest frequency of the filter
      protected double lowSlope
      The slope of first half of the filter.

        public double process(float[] frequencySpectrum,
                      AudioFormat format)
        Requires a power spectrum and produces an output the filter
        Parameters:

        format - The format of the samples used to create the spectrum
        Returns:
        The output power for the filter

      • getResponseCurve

        public double[] getResponseCurve(int nSpectrumBins,
                                 double maxFreq)
        Returns a set of values that represent the response of this filter when the linear frequency is split in the given number of bins. The result will have nSpectrumBins length.
        Parameters:
        nSpectrumBins - The number of bins in a spectrum.
        maxFreq - The maximum frequency (sample rate)
        Returns:
        The response curve.

      • getWeightAt

        public double getWeightAt(double frequency)
        Returns the weighting provided by this filter at the given frequency (Hz).
        Parameters:
        frequency - The frequency (Hz) to get the weight for
        Returns:
        The weight at the given frequency (Hz) for this filter
